entries.title: Jokowi’s Dynasty Takes Shape With Another Son Entering Politics
entries.description: When Joko Widodo became Indonesia’s president nearly a decade ago, he was celebrated as a political outsider. By the time he leaves office next year, he will have a dynasty in place that expands his influence.

entries.title: Pentagon Is Tracking a Chinese Spy Balloon Hovering Over Montana
entries.description: The Pentagon is tracking a Chinese surveillance balloon that’s hovering over US territory and believes it poses no military threat, Defense Department officials said Thursday.

entries.title: South Africa Says Finalizing Climate Plan as Finance Head Quits
entries.description: South Africa is finalizing an implementation plan for an $8.5 billion climate finance deal with some of the world’s richest countries even as the head of the Presidential Climate Finance Task Team quit, a government spokesman said.

entries.title: Lula Says Brazil Needs More Tools to Fight Inflation
entries.description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva defended the use of additional tools besides interest rates to rein in inflation, including a more active policy to reduce foreign exchange volatility and the regulation of fuel prices and food stocks.

entries.title: Domestic Abusers Have Gun Rights Too, US Appeals Court Rules
entries.description: The decades-old US law barring Americans who commit domestic-violence from possessing guns contradicts the nation’s “historical tradition” of access to firearms even for people who aren’t “model citizens,” a federal appeals court ruled.

entries.title: Nissan Techs Can Vote on Union, US Labor Board Rules
entries.description: A group of around 86 Nissan North America Inc. technicians at a Tennessee manufacturing plant can vote on unionization, the US labor board ruled, rejecting the company’s argument that any union election should include thousands more employees.

entries.title: Silvergate Faces US Fraud Probe Over FTX and Alameda Dealings
entries.description: Seal of the US Department of Justice

entries.title: Hochul’s Budget Proposes Tax Break for NYC Office Conversions
entries.description: New York Governor Kathy Hochul’s $227 billion budget includes proposals that would make it easier to convert older office buildings into residential use.

entries.title: Manchin Says Yellen Is ‘Not Following the Law’ on EV Tax Credits
entries.description: Senator Joe Manchin accused US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen of “not following the law” on electric vehicle tax credits as automakers push the Biden administration to apply broad interpretations to a bill that he largely wrote last year.

entries.title: Tesla Expected to Announce Mexico Project Soon, Ebrard Says
entries.description: Tesla Inc. is expected to announce an investment in Mexico very soon as the country works to expand infrastructure and renewable energy supply to take advantage of a boom in companies relocating, Foreign Affairs Minister Marcelo Ebrard said.

entries.title: Bill Clinton Returns to White House to Mark Family Leave Law
entries.description: President Joe Biden hosted former President Bill Clinton at an event Thursday to celebrate the 30th anniversary of the Family and Medical Leave Act, saying the landmark law had made a “gigantic difference” for American families.

entries.title: House GOP Is Investigating Biden Climate Envoy John Kerry
entries.description: House Republicans are launching an investigation into the activities of President Joe Biden’s climate envoy John Kerry, including any dealings with the Chinese Communist Party and left-wing environmental groups.

entries.title: FBI Seeks Information on ION Hack That Disrupted Derivatives
entries.description: The Federal Bureau of Investigation is seeking information on the cyberattack on London-based ION Trading UK that’s snarled global derivatives trading, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

entries.title: DeSantis Proposes Tax Exemption for Gas Stoves, Ridicules Talk of Ban
entries.description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis waded into the debate over gas stoves and government regulation on Thursday, proposing a permanent tax exemption for the appliances.

entries.title: US Transfers Guantanamo Detainee to Belize After Sentence Served
entries.description: The US has transfered a Guantanamo Bay prisoner to Belize after he completed a sentence, as President Joe Biden’s administration says it still plans to eventually close the facility in Cuba.

entries.title: US Backs Banning Russia, Belarus Flags From 2024 Games
entries.description: Athletes from Russia and Belarus should not compete under their nation’s flags or hear their national anthems played during medal presentations during the upcoming Olympics in Paris because of the invasion of Ukraine, the White House said Thursday.

entries.title: Pro-Brexit Tories, Northern Ireland’s DUP Send Sunak a Warning as EU Deal Nears
entries.description: Northern Ireland’s Democratic Unionist Party and a handful of Conservative Members of Parliament issued a warning to UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak over Brexit, foreshadowing domestic obstacles ahead as his government seeks to end a dispute with the European Union.

entries.title: After Tyre Nichols Death, Black Caucus Will Press Biden on Police Reform
entries.description: Members of the Congressional Black Caucus will urge President Joe Biden to consider new executive actions and legislative avenues to advance police reform during their White House meeting Thursday, according to a source familiar with their plans.

entries.title: Trump Is Noncommittal on Supporting GOP Nominee Who’s Not Him
entries.description: Donald Trump won’t commit to supporting the Republican presidential nominee in 2024 if he doesn’t win the nomination, raising the prospects of a nightmare GOP scenario of the former president helping Democrats retain the White House.

entries.title: House Republicans Strip Ilhan Omar of Foreign Affairs Seat
entries.description: House Republicans successfully booted Democrat Ilhan Omar from the Foreign Affairs Committee, removing from the panel a Black Muslim woman who GOP lawmakers have blasted for making antisemitic and anti-Israel comments.

entries.title: Beijing Lobbies US Allies After Push to Contain China’s Chips
entries.description: Days after Japan and the Netherlands joined the US in agreeing to restrict some high-technology exports to China, Beijing has reached out to those American allies, encouraging them to protect existing supply-chain relationships.

entries.title: Sarah Sanders to Give GOP Response to Biden State of the Union
entries.description: Arkansas Governor and former White House Press Secretary Sarah Huckabee Sanders will deliver the Republican response to President Joe Biden’s State of the Union address next Tuesday.

entries.title: Brazil’s Rate Cut Prospects Dim After Hawkish Central Bank Message
entries.description: Central bank voices concern about rising inflation expectations in Latin America’s largest economy

entries.title: UK’s Wallace Seeks Greater Military Spending to Counter Inflation
entries.description: Defence Secretary Ben Wallace said he’s pushing the Treasury for more military spending at the UK budget in March to offset the country’s double-digit inflation.

entries.title: Chaos in Serb Assembly as Vucic Sticks to EU, Kosovo Talks
entries.description: Serbian parliament devolved into chaos on Thursday as President Aleksandar Vucic urged lawmakers to stay in the European Union fold even as the bloc demands “painful” concessions on Kosovo.

entries.title: Bipartisan Lawmaker Duo Starts Big Tech Antitrust Caucus
entries.description: A bipartisan pair of lawmakers on Thursday vowed to keep a focus on reforming US antitrust laws to curb the power of Amazon.com, Inc; Apple Inc.; Alphabet Inc.’s Google and Meta Platforms, Inc.

entries.title: Myanmar Junta Imposes Martial Law in Resistance Strongholds
entries.description: Myanmar’s military government imposed martial law in 37 townships across the country where clashes with resistance groups have intensified in the past months, signaling more brutal oppression in pro-democracy strongholds.

entries.title: Ireland’s Makhlouf Warns of Brexit, Fintech Growth Challenges
entries.description: Ireland’s central bank governor Gabriel Makhlouf warned Finance Minister Michael McGrath that the growth of financial technology, Irish government policy and Brexit have created “challenges” for its job as a regulator.

entries.title: Putin Vows Ukraine Victory as He Hails WWII Stalingrad Triumph
entries.description: President Vladimir Putin warned the US and its allies they can’t defeat Russia, rallying domestic support for his invasion of Ukraine in a speech marking a key victory in World War II.

entries.title: Biden’s Top Economic Aide Brian Deese Is Leaving the White House
entries.description: President Joe Biden announced that his top economic adviser, Brian Deese, would step down as director of the National Economic Council, in a statement on Thursday.

entries.title: Peru’s Top Diplomat Sees 2023 Elections as the Way to End Crisis
entries.description: Peru is committed to new elections this year as the way out of the damaging political crisis roiling the nation, its top diplomat told officials in Washington this week.

entries.title: Russia to Press Assault in Ukraine’s East as Kyiv Waits for More Weapons
entries.description: The latest assessments from Ukraine’s allies point to some difficult weeks ahead for its forces, who now face as many as 300,000 Russian troops along the front lines.

entries.title: Biden Budget Chief Sees ‘Marathon’ Path to Debt Limit Deal
entries.description: President Joe Biden’s budget director said she thinks Republicans and Democrats will eventually reach a budget deal and avert a breach of the debt ceiling.

entries.title: Republicans Itch to Take On Trump: Here's Who Is in the Mix So Far
entries.description: Nikki Haley is the first of several potential challengers of the former president for the 2024 Republican nomination.

entries.title: Journalist Who Exposed Russia Spies Flees Vienna on Safety Fears
entries.description: An investigative journalist who exposed Kremlin spies and sought to document the alleged poisoning of Russian opposition leader Alexey Navalny said he fled Vienna for fear of undercover agents operating in his home of two decades.

entries.title: Pelosi Endorses Schiff Senate Run If Feinstein Bows Out
entries.description: Former House Speaker Nancy Pelosi said she would endorse Representative Adam Schiff’s bid for a coveted Senate seat from California if Senator Dianne Feinstein, 89, does not run again in 2024.

entries.title: Biden's Antitrust Push Is Best Chance in Years to Rein In Google
entries.description: DOJ antitrust chief Jonathan Kanter has long had his sights on the internet giant

entries.title: UK Hints at Role for European Court in Brexit N. Ireland Deal
entries.description: The UK hinted that it’s willing to allow the European Court of Justice to retain a role of some sort in Northern Ireland, suggesting a compromise on the most difficult issue in its long-running post-Brexit dispute with the European Union.

entries.title: Spain, Morocco Say Feuding Days Are Over as Europe Courts Africa
entries.description: The Spanish and Moroccan governments vowed to deepen diplomatic and trade ties, drawing a line under years of bitter disputes that threatened to undermine security and energy interests.

entries.title: Norway Set to Tap Its Oil Wealth to Finance War Aid for Ukraine
entries.description: Norway plans to use its $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund to pay for a planned long-term aid program to Ukraine, Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store said.

entries.title: Turkey Rebuffs Idea Erdogan Will Allow Higher Interest Rates After Election
entries.description: Turkey will keep interest rates low after elections in May, the country’s finance chief said, rejecting the view of some Wall Street banks that expect a U-turn in its unconventional monetary policy.

entries.title: UK, Australian Leaders to Unveil Nuclear Submarine Plan at White House
entries.description: UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak and his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese will travel to Washington DC in mid-March to unveil a plan for Australia’s nuclear submarine project, according to a person familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Gloomy UK Weighs a Hundred Days of Sunak
entries.description: One hundred days ago today, the UK’s ruling Conservative Party — and the financial markets — breathed a deep sigh of relief when Rishi Sunak became prime minister.

entries.title: Sweden Seeks to Ban Terrorism Support as Turkey Stalls NATO Bid
entries.description: Sweden’s government proposed a new law to ban activities that support terror organizations, as its bid to join NATO has stalled over Turkish objections.

entries.title: Two European Lawmakers Stripped of Immunity in Bribe Scandal
entries.description: Two more lawmakers were stripped of their immunity from prosecution in the latest escalation of the Qatar-linked bribery scandal that’s sparked a crackdown on corruption at the heart of European Union decision making.

entries.title: Pakistan Launches $2.7 Billion China-Designed Nuclear Plant
entries.description: Pakistan inaugurated a $2.7 billion nuclear reactor, providing some relief as the nation grapples with an energy crisis.

entries.title: US and China Talk About Better Ties But Things Have Only Become Worse
entries.description: The US keeps saying it wants to set a “floor” under the relationship with China. Its recent moves against Beijing and new pressure from Congress make achieving that look increasingly unlikely.

entries.title: Apple, Google Urged to Remove TikTok From App Stores by Democratic Senator
entries.description: Senator Michael Bennet, a Colorado Democrat and member of the Intelligence Committee, has asked the chief executive officers of  Apple Inc.  and Alphabet Inc.’s Google to remove TikTok, the Chinese-owned video-sharing platform, from their app stores, citing “grave” national security concerns.

entries.title: The Utility Ruining South Africa Is a Big Winner for Bondholders
entries.description: South Africa’s Eskom Holdings SOC Ltd. is not very good at keeping the lights on, but it’s providing excellent profits for bondholders.

entries.title: EU Diplomats Warn on Slovakia’s Opposition as Election Nears
entries.description: Senior European diplomats raised concerns over Slovakia’s opposition after meeting former Prime Minister Robert Fico, who is seeking a return to power in an early election this September.

entries.title: France’s Le Maire Expects Lawmaker Majority for Pension Reform
entries.description: French Finance Minister Bruno Le Maire said he’s confident the government will get its unpopular pension reform through parliament without resorting to controversial constitutional measures to bypass a vote.

entries.title: UN Started Stricter Checks After Iran Hiked Nuclear Enrichment
entries.description: International nuclear monitors have started conducting unannounced inspections at a uranium enrichment site in Iran after it hiked levels closer to weapons-grade last year.

entries.title: Netanyahu Blocked From Involvement in Judicial Overhaul Plan
entries.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, who is on trial over graft allegations, must avoid involvement in his government’s plans to overhaul the judiciary due to a potential conflict of interest, Israel’s attorney general said.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Zelenskiy Says Russian Offensive Intensifying
entries.description: Russia’s offensive is intensifying with the approach of Feb. 24, the invasion’s one-year mark, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said Wednesday night. It followed a comment earlier in the week that a new phase of the conflict “has started.” Poland’s prime minister outlined a potential plan by Russian to surround Ukraine on multiple fronts, including from Belarus in the north, where Kremlin troops have been amassing.

entries.title: Ant Chairman Says China’s Support for Private Firms Remains
entries.description: Ant Group Co. Chairman Eric Jing highlighted the support private companies are receiving from the government in a state-media report, emerging in public view following more than two years of regulatory crackdowns on the sector.

entries.title: Tank for a Franc? Swiss Weigh Fire Sale of Arms Over Debate on How to Help Ukraine
entries.description: In a bunker in mountainous eastern Switzerland, nearly 100 Leopard 2 tanks have been mothballed for almost a decade, destined for decommissioning in the belief that armored warfare in Europe was a thing of the past.

entries.title: Iran Blames Israel for Drone Attack and Hints At Response
entries.description: Iran on Thursday blamed Israel for a drone attack on an ammunition depot last weekend that has escalated tensions in the energy-rich Persian Gulf, and said it had the right to respond.

entries.title: India Opposition Seeks Parliament Debate on Adani Stock Rout
entries.description: India’s opposition Congress party will ask for a parliament debate on tycoon Gautam Adani’s tussle with a US short seller and the impact of the resulting stock rout on millions of small investors, according to two people with knowledge of the matter.

entries.title: Japan Urges Regional Banks to Raise Wages as Inflation Jumps
entries.description: Japan’s financial regulator is urging regional banks to raise wages for employees, people familiar with the matter said, responding to Prime Minister Fumio Kishida’s call for higher pay with inflation hitting its highest level since 1981.

entries.title: Why Congo and Rwanda Are at Each Other’s Throats
entries.description: Violence in the east of the Democratic Republic of Congo is escalating and fears are mounting of a wider conflict in what has long been one of Africa’s most volatile regions. President Felix Tshisekedi accuses his counterpart in neighboring Rwanda, Paul Kagame, of supporting a rebel group known as M23. Kagame denies the allegation and counters that Tshisekedi’s inability to control events in his own country poses a security risk to Rwanda. The acrimony reached new heights in late January, when R

entries.title: Sweden’s 27-Year-Old Climate Minister Is Ready to Quit If Goals Are Missed
entries.description: To live up to its climate promises, Sweden’s new government depends on the support of a far-right party that has called climate change a myth.

entries.title: Sunak’s First 100 Days Were Hit by Strikes and Scandal. Now What?
entries.description: The hard work is only beginning for the UK prime minister.

entries.title: Unions Get a Taste for Mass Strikes After UK’s Day of Action
entries.description: The UK’s labor unions emerged emboldened from the country’s worst day of strikes for a decade, threatening further coordinated action to force the government’s hand in pay negotiations.

entries.title: Hong Kong Is About to Give Away Half a Million Airline Tickets
entries.description: Hong Kong officials are expected to announce details of a plan to distribute 500,000 air tickets as part of a global publicity campaign to be unveiled on Thursday.

entries.title: Hunter Biden’s Lawyers Go On Offense Against Accusers as House GOP Readies Hearings
entries.description: Lawyers for Hunter Biden, President Joe Biden’s son, asked federal and state prosecutors to investigate people he accused of accessing and disseminating personal data, and also threatened Fox News host Tucker Carlson with a defamation suit.

entries.title: US Gets Access to More Philippine Bases as China Tensions Linger
entries.description: The US is set to expand its access to more Philippine military bases, paving the way for greater American presence in the Asia-Pacific as tensions with China over Taiwan and the South China Sea persist.

entries.title: Malaysia Freezes Opposition Party’s Accounts Amid Graft Probe
entries.description: Malaysian anti-graft authorities have frozen the bank accounts of an opposition party led by former prime minister Muhyiddin Yassin amid an investigation that the pro-Malay group said was an attempt to destroy its credibility.

entries.title: Teen Held After Planning ISIS Caliphate, Stabbing Attacks in Singapore
entries.description: A teen has been detained by Singapore authorities on suspicion of planning to set up an Islamic caliphate and undertake armed violence in support of ISIS.

entries.title: Biden, Modi Aides Discussing Possible State Visit to Washington
entries.description: Aides for US President Joe Biden and Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi are discussing a possible state visit to Washington later this year, according to people familiar with the discussions.

entries.title: Israeli Military Says It’s Launching a Strike in Gaza
entries.description: The Israel Defense Forces said it was striking Gaza, without providing further details of the move that follows a visit by the US Secretary of State Antony Blinken, who sought to defuse tensions after some of the deadliest inter-communal violence in years.

entries.title: Fate of $8 Billion Alaska Oil Project Comes Down to the Next 30 Days
entries.description: It’s been called a “carbon bomb” and a caribou killer. Now, climate activists have one final, brief window of opportunity to quash ConocoPhillips’s proposed $8 billion oil development in Alaska.

entries.title: North Korea Shuts Door on US Talks, Raising Risk of Provocations
entries.description: North Korea’s Foreign Ministry said the door remains shut for talks with the US on winding down its atomic arsenal, setting the stage for renewed provocations by pledging to respond to what it saw as threats from Washington.
